edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI

  • public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    The UI class represents the interface through which the player will interact with the game world. It exists as an object within the GameEngine, and is queried whenever input/output to the player is needed. The class is able to pass any necessary input from the player to interact with their Player character.
    Author:
    Aidan Novobilski

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UI.action
      This field represents all possible actions that a player can take on a turn.
      static class  UI.direction
      This field represents all possible directions that a player could possibly input.
      static class  UI.mode
      This field represents all possible modes that the player can input.

    • Field Detail

      • sc

        private java.util.Scanner sc
        This field represents the Scanner object that will read all player input into the console. It is initialized during the constructor and used whenever the player's input is needed.

      • input

        private java.lang.String input
        This field represents the stored input of the player. Initialized within any method that reads input, since String is immutable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UI

        public UI()
        The default constructor. Initializes the Scanner object.

    • Method Detail

      • printTitle

        public void printTitle()
        This method prints the "title screen" of the game, as well as ask the player if they would like to play the game.

      • selectMode

        public UI.mode selectMode()
        This method will ask the player whether they would like to play in normal mode or debug mode, and return their choice.
        Returns:
        Returns DEBUG or NORMAL

      • printRules

        public void printRules()
        This method will print the rules of the game. It will also explain to the player how to interpret the map screen.

      • readAction

        public UI.action readAction()
        This method will query the player for input on what action they wish to take. It will then interpret their input and return either LOOK, MOVE, or SHOOT. If their input is invalid, it will print "Invalid input." and query the player again.
        Returns:
        Returns LOOK, MOVE, or SHOOT.

      • readDirection

        public UI.direction readDirection()
        This method will query the player for input on what direction they wish to act towards. It will interpret their input and return one of the four cardinal directions. If their input is invalid, it will print "Invalid input." and query the player again.
        Returns:
        Returns UP, DOWN, LEFT, or RIGHT.

      • printMap

        public void printMap(Entity[][] entities)
        This method will draw the map within the console. The player character will be represented with "@", blank space will be represented with ".", and the rooms will be represented with "R". If debug mode is enabled, the game will also show the location of the ninjas with "N" and the briefcase with "B" and powerups with various symbols (b, i, and r). The entire map will be surrounded with walls represented by "#".
        Parameters:
        entities - The entities

      • printLegend

        public void printLegend(boolean debug)
        This method will inform the player what the characters on the map stand for.
        Parameters:
        debug - Whether the game is in debug mode or not.

      • printPlayerDied

        public void printPlayerDied(int lives)
        This method will inform the player that they were killed by a ninja. In addition, it will tell them how many lives they have remaining.
        Parameters:
        lives - The number of lives the player has remaining.

      • printPowerUp

        public void printPowerUp(java.lang.String powerUpName)
        This method will inform the player that they have just picked up a power up. In addition, it will take the name as an argument to tell them which power up it was and what they gained.
        Parameters:
        powerUpName - The name of the power up the player picked up.

      • printVictory

        public void printVictory()
        This method will inform the player that they have successfully found the briefcase and print the map showing the locations of all ninjas and power ups.

      • printGameOver

        public void printGameOver()
        This method will inform the player that they were killed by a ninja and have lost their final life, and print the map showing the locations of all ninjas and power ups.

      • askIfPlayingAgain

        public void askIfPlayingAgain()
        This method will ask the player whether they would like to play again. If they answer some variation of "No" or "Quit", the UI will call goodbye() and quit the game.

      • queryLoad

        public java.lang.String queryLoad()
        This method will ask the player where their save file is located to load.
        Returns:
        The name/location of the file to load.

      • querySave

        public java.lang.String querySave()
        This method will ask the player where to save their save file and what they would like to name it.
        Returns:
        The name/location of the file to save.

      • goodbye

        public void goodbye()
        This method prints a "goodbye" message to the player and quits the game safely.
